alert.note: Alert for Big Island East; Big Island North; Kauai North; Koolau Windward; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Olomana; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 13 at 3:20AM HST until January 13 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST TODAY FOR THE NORTH FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI MAUI AND THE BIG ISLAND... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IS CANCELLED FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU AND MOLOKAI... ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH THE MORNING FOR ALL HAWAIIAN ISLANDS... .A peaking north-northwest (350 degree) swell will slowly decline today at high end advisory levels for exposed north facing shores. Additional wave run- up is possible during the early morning high tides today and Sunday due to higher than predicted tides. This will likely produce minor to localized coastal flooding this morning. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, surf peaking at 15 to 20 feet along north facing shores. For the Coastal Flood Statement, minor to localized moderate low lying coastal flooding during times of high tide. * WHERE...For the High Surf Advisory, north facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, Maui and the Big Island. For the Coastal Flood Statement, any low lying flood prone coastal location. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 6 PM HST this evening. For the Coastal Flood Statement, until 6 AM HST early this morning. * IMPACTS...Flooding of beaches that are normally dry, minor coastal erosion, and saltwater inundation. Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous. Submit your coastal flooding photos to the University of Hawaii Sea Grant College Program`s Hawaii and Pacific Islands King Tides Project at: PacificIslandsKingTides.org
info.instruction: Avoid driving through flooded roadways. If you are forced to drive through salt water, be sure to rinse your vehicle with fresh water. Move electronics, vehicles or other valuables to higher ground. Monitor vessels to ensure mooring lines don`t get too tight and watch out for overwash around boat ramps. Secure canoes or other watercraft stowed on beaches. Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
